subject: Re: [junit] How can I automatize a mouse click ?
msgSnippet: It was only a suggestion - I haven t ever had to do this, but then 95% of the java code I write is server-side and has no GUI... I wasn t aware of these
messageBody:
It was only a suggestion - I haven't ever had to do this, but then 95%
of the java code I write is server-side and has no GUI... I wasn't aware
of these packages, and would certainly have recommended them had I known
of them.

Still, I stand by my comment on the long term solution being a
separation of GUI and other code.

Regards,
Jim


Thomas L Roche wrote:

> James Cheesman Tue Apr 27, 2004 8:37 am
>
>>You could also play around with java.awt.Robot
>
>
> Why do that, when you could use one of the several excellent packages
> built atop it, e.g. Abbot, Jemmy, JfcUnit? IIRC these all rely on
> j.a.R to put UI events on the native queue (which is why they provide
> real, not mock, testing of Java GUIs), but they relieve the user of
> the need to find widget co-ordinates @ runtime, as well as other
> useful high-level semantics. (Note that "Abbot" is short for "A Better
> 'Bot" :-) Don't play with j.a.R, start writing testcases!
>
>
>
